meanings.definition: Form an opinion before possessing full information or experience.
meanings.sent1: She preconceives the outcome of the game before even watching it.
meanings.sent2: He always preconceives the difficulty of a task before attempting it.
meanings.sent3: The cat preconceives that the vacuum cleaner is a monster.
meanings.sent4: His preconceived notion of success as a straight line was shattered by life's twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: Before the trip, she preconceives the beauty of the destination in her mind.

meanings.definition: To conceive or form an opinion beforehand.
meanings.sent1: They preconceive the weather to be sunny for the picnic.
meanings.sent2: She preconceives the taste of the dish before even trying it.
meanings.sent3: The student preconceives that the test will be easy, but reality proves otherwise.
meanings.sent4: His preconceived idea of love as a fairytale was challenged by real relationships.
meanings.sent5: Before the movie starts, he preconceives the plot based on the trailer.
